clauses.title: Lease Term
clauses.summary: This clause defines the start and end dates of the lease agreement. Knowing the term is crucial for planning and understanding your commitment to the property.
obligations: Tenant must occupy the premises for the full term.
Tenant is responsible for rent throughout the term.
risks: Potential for renewal issues if not addressed before the end of the term.
clauses.original_text: The Agreement shall begin on _________________ and end on _________________ (“Term”).

clauses.title: Rent Payment
clauses.summary: This clause specifies the monthly rent amount and due date. Timely rent payment avoids late fees and potential eviction proceedings.
obligations: Tenant must pay the specified rent amount.
Tenant must pay rent on the specified date each month.
risks: Late payment fees if rent is not paid on time.
clauses.original_text: The Tenant shall pay the Landlord in equal monthly installments of $___________ (“Rent”). The Rent shall be due on the ____ of every month and paid under the following instructions: ____________________________________________________________________________.

clauses.title: Security Deposit
clauses.summary: This clause outlines the security deposit amount and the conditions for its return. The deposit protects the landlord against damage beyond normal wear and tear.
obligations: Tenant must pay the security deposit (if required).
Tenant must leave the premises in good condition.
risks: Potential for deductions from the deposit for damages.
clauses.original_text:
The Tenant (check one):
☐ Shall deposit with the Landlord the sum of $___________ as security for any damage caused
to the Premises during the Term. Such deposit shall be returned to the Tenant, less any itemized
deductions, within ______ days after the end of the Term.
